snippet: Research by Emmanuel Saez and Thomas Piketty, two French economists known simply as Piketty-Saez in Washington, has provided the subtext to the battle over tax fairness.
abstract: Emmanuel Saez and Thomas Piketty, French economists whose work has provided the subtext to the battle over tax fairness, argue that the so-called Buffet Rule, Democrats' bold plan to increase taxes on the wealthy by 30 percent, would do little to reverse the gains of the wealthiest Americans; Saez and Piketty estimate that top tax rates for the wealthy should between 45 and 70 percent.
lead_paragraph: Research by Emmanuel Saez and Thomas Piketty, two French economists known simply as Piketty-Saez in Washington, has provided the subtext to the battle over tax fairness.

headline.seo: For Economists Saez and Piketty, the Buffett Rule Is Just a Start
headline.main: For Two Economists, the Buffett Rule Is Just a Start
headline.print_headline: French Duo See (Well) Past Tax Rise for Richest
